description:

The Master of Science in Aeronautics degree program builds on Embry-Riddle’s strong aviation foundation, providing students with a deep understanding of aviation and aerospace operations, safety, security, and regulations. description:
The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) degree is a broad, yet deep program designed to provide aviation and aerospace professionals with a keen understanding of aviation and aerospace operations, safety, security, systems, quality and management. Offered by the College of Aeronautics, the MSA is a completely online degree that allows students the flexibility to work on their studies anytime, anywhere in the world.

The curriculum provides a strong, technical foundation for those looking to advance their career. Graduates are prepared for leadership and management roles in all segments of aviation and aerospace, including airlines, airports, corporate aviation, government, and the U.S. military. Graduates of the M.S. in Aeronautics program are set up for a competitive advantage to advance their careers.

Within the Small Unmanned Aircraft Systems (sUAS) Operation specialization, students will learn about topics critical to the sUAS operation industry including sUAS design, control and navigation, applications, data collection and processing as well as safety and human factors.

description: The Master of Science in Aeronautics (MSA) is a multi-disciplinary program that combines a core of aviation and aerospace courses with a choice of specialization options, enabling you to tailor a degree program that elevates your career. Our Aviation Safety specialization provides students with the technical skills required in the areas of accident investigation, safety management and human factors in aviation.

Embry-Riddle's alumni network and industry partnerships are a valuable resource for students to leverage when seeking mentorship and career advancement opportunities. MSA students then work with their advisors to customize a curriculum that matches their interests and career goals by choosing from a wide variety of electives and an area of specialization.

The Master of Science in Aerospace Business Analytics degree from Embry-Riddle provides the analytical skills and business acumen necessary to expertly analyze and communicate critical business data to key decision-makers.

Embry-Riddle’s unique program emphasizes application over theory by combining the study of aerospace business with data analytics. Students will learn how to approach, analyze and communicate information in order to develop better business practices and results.

Available at Embry-Riddle’s Daytona Beach Campus, this degree is ideal for those who want to use their data and analytical skills to work in the aerospace and aviation sectors. The curriculum is focused on producing expert analysts who possess the creative thinking and problem-solving skills needed to succeed in business.

Students will also gain an understanding of airworthiness engineering processes and the regulations that govern the aircraft industry.

Students who already have a degree in aerospace, mechanical or another related engineering field and are interested in the design, development and certification of aircraft will benefit from this unique program.

Students in the program explore all facets of the aerospace industry, including air traffic management, airport design and development, airline operations, aviation safety and security, and aircraft maintenance management. The curriculum also delves into the legal, regulatory, and labor aspects of the industry, as well as environmental issues and challenges. This comprehensive approach provides graduates with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed in various aviation roles, such as airline manager, airport manager, air traffic controller, aviation safety inspector, and aviation consultant. With an MSA degree from Embry-Riddle, graduates are well-equipped to advance their careers and make a significant impact in the aviation industry.

Students with a technical background get the business acumen they need to become managers and executives while those with a business background learn the ins-and-outs of the highly specialized aviation industry. The MBA-AM degree is offered completely online, allowing you to tailor your education to your schedule. Many faculty members have years of experience working in the aviation industry, and class sizes are small so you'll receive the individual attention you deserve. The MBA-AM degree has a wide variety of career opportunities, and we have the tools to help you reach your goals.

description:
The Master of Science in Data Science degree at Embry-Riddle prepares its students for careers that apply data analysis, visualization, and machine learning to solve real-world problems. The curriculum combines a core of data science theory and methods with three specializations for students to explore their interests: Aviation & Aerospace, Business Analytics, and Cybersecurity.

Students will use modern techniques and tools in programming, statistics, machine learning, and data management to store, process, analyze, manage, and visualize big data. They will also build the skills to communicate the results of their analyses to a broad audience.
Program name: Master of Science in Data Science

Students will acquire specialized skills in finance, marketing, human resources, and project management in combination with systems engineering, quality control, and supply chain management. Graduates will be equipped to manage technical teams, complex projects, and global operations in a variety of industries, including aerospace, manufacturing, and technology.

description:
The Master of Science in Human Factors is an online degree that focuses on optimizing human performance and safety through the design of systems, products and work environments.

The 30-credit-hour program builds on the foundations of human factors and allows students to explore areas related to their specific interests through one of three specializations.

At Embry-Riddle, students receive a world-class education from highly knowledgeable faculty who have decades of practical industry experience.

The curriculum focuses on both the theoretical and practical application of human factors and is designed for working professionals who want to advance their careers and leadership roles.

The program culminates in a human factors capstone project where students will work with faculty to research and solve a real-world problem.
Program name: Master of Science in Human Factors

description: The Master of Science in Human Security & Resilience (MSHSR) is an online 30-credit-hour program that prepares graduates to analyze and respond to a wide array of man-made and natural threats to human security. The program provides students with an in-depth understanding of the major theories and practices in the fields of security and resilience. The core curriculum provides a solid foundation in the key areas of the discipline, to include: security policy and practice, hazard mitigation and resilience, research methods and analytical techniques. The MSHSR degree prepares students for careers in government, the private sector and non-governmental organizations with a focus on national and international security. Students will be well-positioned to pursue advanced doctoral studies in a wide array of fields, including security studies, international relations, political science, public policy and criminal justice. Experienced managers and technical professionals from all disciplines will benefit from the program, as it has been designed to provide the necessary skills and knowledge for a leader in any technical-oriented business. The program equips graduates to oversee and manage diverse teams, projects and processes to reach organizational goals. Coursework within the program develops a student’s core competency and proficiency in the areas of accounting, finance, economics, human resources, marketing, business development, leadership and project management. Students will be able to customize their degree with a specialization in Engineering Management, Global Management, Leadership or Operations Management.

description:
With a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MSME), students can either broaden their mechanical engineering education or focus on a specific area of interest. At Embry-Riddle, students are encouraged to innovate and explore a multitude of mechanical engineering fields, such as robotics, unmanned vehicles, space systems, energy, and biomedical systems. The MSME program is focused on advanced topics within mechanical engineering, and our state-of-the-art labs and facilities ensure students have access to the tools they need for in-depth research and development.
The MSME program is offered at both the Daytona Beach Campus and the Prescott Campus and is housed in the Department of Mechanical Engineering in the College of Engineering.
Students will learn from experienced faculty who share their expertise in fields such as:
Robotics
Energy systems
Unmanned autonomous systems
High-performance vehicles
Advanced materials and manufacturing
Spacecraft systems
The Daytona Beach Campus offers thesis and non-thesis options, with specializations available in High-Performance Vehicles and Robotics and Unmanned Autonomous Systems.
The Prescott Campus offers a thesis option only.
The program’s objective is to produce graduates who have in-depth knowledge of mechanical engineering and can creatively apply their knowledge to the synthesis, design and analysis of complex systems for aerospace and general engineering applications.
Program name: Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering

description: The Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management is for students with an undergraduate background in occupational safety or a related field. The 30-credit program is designed to provide students with the knowledge to establish and manage occupational safety programs within various professional environments, such as aviation, military and manufacturing. The degree program offers a unique experience to students by allowing them to work with the latest technologies while learning from faculty members who are industry experts and have firsthand knowledge of working in the field. Students will get hands-on experience and learn to apply their knowledge to solve critical industry challenges. Upon completing this program, graduates will have the necessary skills to effectively manage safety programs within the industry of their choice. This degree also provides a competitive edge for working professionals who are seeking advancement in their careers.
Accreditation status: The Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management degree is accredited by the Aviation Accreditation Board International (AABI).
Program name: Master of Science in Occupational Safety Management

description:
The Master of Science in Space Operations (M.S.S.O.) is an exciting and unique program that provides students with a broad and deep understanding of the space environment, space systems and space operations. The program is designed for students who want to work in the military, government or commercial space sectors as space systems operators, managers, analysts, or policymakers. The M.S.S.O. program is a 30-credit-hour program that can be completed in as little as 18 months. The program is offered completely online, allowing for maximum flexibility for students who are working professionals or who are geographically dispersed.

The M.S.S.O. is tailored to both the military and civilian professional looking to master all aspects of space systems, from the policies and laws that govern their use to the technical understanding of how space systems are designed and operated. Students in the Space Operations degree program will learn about orbital mechanics, space environment, spacecraft systems, space operations, space policy and law, space systems management and space systems applications.

The program culminates in a capstone project that allows students to apply their knowledge and skills to a real-world space operations problem.
Program name: Master of Science in Space Operations

description:
The Master of Science in Systems Engineering (MSSE) degree program at Embry-Riddle is focused on preparing students for an exciting career designing and managing complex engineering projects. The curriculum provides a strong foundation in systems engineering and management with a focus on meeting the needs of the industry.

The 30-credit-hour program provides a strong foundation and bridges multiple disciplines. Students will explore all aspects of systems, including requirements definition, system design and development, and systems verification and validation. Students will learn the tools and techniques to manage complex systems both from a technical and management perspective.

Embry-Riddle's Systems Engineering graduates are prepared to create and execute complex projects that require broad technical and management backgrounds. They have been hired by a wide range of companies, including Rockwell Collins, The Boeing Company, and The Federal Aviation Administration.
Program name: Master of Science in Systems Engineering

This degree program prepares students for leadership and management positions that require industry expertise. Graduates of this program will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to manage uncrewed systems programs over their life cycle, including their design and development, operation and management, and policy issues. The MSUS degree program is housed in the Department of Graduate Studies within the College of Aeronautics.
Program name: Master of Science in Uncrewed Systems

Upon graduation, Ph.D. in Aviation students are prepared for careers as university faculty, industry and government leaders, and senior researchers.

Through a commitment to research and teaching, Ph.D. students will have an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the future of the aviation industry. description:
The Embry-Riddle Doctor of Aviation Business Administration (D.A.B.A) is the first of its kind in the nation. It is designed for experienced professionals looking to further their knowledge and skills in the field of aviation business. This terminal degree program provides students with a rigorous, research-based curriculum that prepares them for leadership roles in the aviation industry.

The D.A.B.A. program has three primary objectives. First, it will provide students with a strong foundation in aviation business theory and practice. Second, it will develop students’ research and analytical skills so they can identify and solve complex problems in the aviation industry. Third, it will prepare students for leadership roles in the aviation industry by teaching them how to effectively manage people, resources and projects.

Students in the D.A.B.A. program will learn about a wide range of topics, including aviation finance, marketing, operations, and strategy. They will also learn how to conduct research and write scholarly papers. Upon graduation, students will be prepared to pursue careers as executives, consultants, and researchers in the aviation industry.

Embry-Riddle’s Ph.D. in Engineering Physics program is designed for students with a passion for physics and a desire to pursue their interests through research at the highest level. Students have the opportunity to work alongside leading experts in the field, utilizing sophisticated equipment and facilities to help push the boundaries of science.

The program’s mission is to produce professionals who can conduct, lead, and manage original research in government or industry, or join the academia.

Research specializations are available in Space Physics, Atmospheric Physics, Remote Sensing, Optical & Photonic Engineering, and Materials Physics.

Our doctoral candidates are immersed in an interdisciplinary environment with close ties to the departments of aerospace, mechanical, and electrical engineering, as well as being part of ERAU's rapidly expanding research programs.
Program name: PhD in Engineering Physics

description:
The Embry-Riddle Ph.D. in Human Factors is designed for students who wish to further their knowledge of human capabilities and limitations, and to apply this knowledge to the design, operation, and maintenance of the systems and technologies that we use every day. The interdisciplinary doctoral program emphasizes both research and practice in the application of human factors principles.

The degree is housed in the Department of Human Factors and Behavioral Neurobiology in the College of Arts and Sciences on the Daytona Beach Campus.

Students who earn a Ph.D. in Human Factors will possess the knowledge and skills to make significant research contributions or to be a practitioner in high-technology settings like aviation, aerospace, healthcare, and surface transportation.

The program offers a diverse yet structured curriculum, allowing students from a variety of backgrounds to pursue their academic goals. Ph.D. students will learn about human factors and ergonomics, cognitive psychology, perception, research design, and statistics. They will have the opportunity to take specialized courses in areas such as human-computer interaction, automation, organizational behavior, accident investigation, and simulation.

Doctoral students are required to conduct original, empirical research as part of their dissertation. Throughout their studies at Embry-Riddle, students in the Human Factors Ph.D. program will work closely with a faculty mentor to develop and refine their research ideas.
Program name: PhD in Human Factors

The doctoral program prepares students to become highly-skilled researchers, university professors, and industry leaders. Students will not only possess expertise in their field of study, but will also have the tools to discover, generate, apply, and transmit new knowledge.

From designing more efficient aircraft engines to developing new sources of energy, mechanical engineers make a difference in the world by developing creative solutions. The program combines a strong research-based foundation with an emphasis on aerospace and aviation applications, while also embracing broader applications.

Coursework will cover theory and application in areas of mechanical engineering such as advanced materials, instrumentation and data acquisition, computational fluid dynamics, multiphase flow, and more. Students will also complete a required teaching practicum.
Program name: PhD in Mechanical Engineering

description: The Certificate of Completion in Airline Management program offers business-focused courses designed to give students a comprehensive understanding of the airline industry, covering topics such as airline operations, management, marketing, finance, and economics. Students will gain the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in various roles within the airline industry, including positions in airline management, operations, marketing, and finance. The program is ideal for individuals seeking to enter the airline industry, as well as for current airline professionals looking to advance their careers. The program culminates in a capstone course that allows students to apply their knowledge to a real-world airline management project.
Program name: Certificate in Airline Management

description: The Graduate Certificate in Airworthiness Engineering is a 12-credit graduate-level, non-degree program for working professionals and graduate students who want to develop or expand their skills in the field of airworthiness engineering. This certificate program provides a strong foundation of knowledge in aircraft certification and continuing airworthiness for students with a bachelor's degree in engineering or a related technical discipline. The knowledge gained from this program can assist engineers and managers in developing safe, airworthy aircraft. This certificate program is offered through Embry-Riddle’s Worldwide & Online Campus.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Airworthiness Engineering

description: Embry-Riddle’s Graduate Certificate in Human Factors program provides students with a solid foundation in human factors principles and practices. The program is designed for working professionals who want to expand their knowledge in human factors or are looking to switch careers. Students will gain the skills to design and evaluate systems that are safe, effective and desirable for human use. The certificate program requires the completion of four courses, which may also be applied toward a Master of Science in Human Factors degree. Graduates with this certificate are prepared for careers in a variety of industries, including aviation, healthcare, automotive and consumer products.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Human Factors

description: The Graduate Certificate in Marketing provides students with skills critical for any professional seeking to move into a leadership position. The coursework offers opportunities to develop and implement marketing strategies, while strengthening the overall understanding of organizational behavior and structure. Students gain the skills to develop, implement and control marketing activities, combined with the core values to rise to the top of an organization. This certificate will also develop critical thinking skills that are necessary to evaluate global marketing issues.
Accreditation status: The David B. O'Maley College of Business at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP).
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Marketing

description:
As industries like aviation, aerospace, manufacturing, technology and healthcare become more complex, the need for skilled project managers continues to rise. The Graduate Certificate in Project Management from Embry-Riddle provides students with the foundational expertise required to effectively manage projects and can be a valuable differentiator when it comes to job opportunities and career advancement.

Students learn the processes and techniques needed to improve project efficiency and organizational effectiveness. The certificate also serves as an excellent pathway to the Master of Science in Project Management (MSPM) degree. Credits completed in the certificate program may be transferred into the MSPM degree with departmental approval.
Program name: Graduate Certificate in Project Management
